content: We archived #cranelift-new-backend just a few hours ago, but now I've discovered a possible downside to archival (vs... something else?): there's no way to view the history, as far as I can tell. That's a lot of valuable design discussion lost. Possibly we could bring it back and just rename to something else? cc @Till Schneidereit

Hmm, actually, a bit more searching (for message content I knew should be there) shows that the stream exists at this hidden URL: here as fd9a1d4!DEACTIVATED!cranelift-new-backend. Maybe we could rename it to "cranelift-backends-2020" or something similarly date-stamped to make clear it's obsolete?

hum, that is indeed unfortunateâ€”it'd be much nicer if Zulip had a way to prevent posting in a channel, but without making it so hard to find. Even more unfortunate is that currently there's no way to undo the archiving, see this help entry: https://zulip.com/help/archive-a-stream

I wish I had seen this before, including the "In most cases, we recommend renaming streams rather than archiving them" :frown:

Archive a stream (Zulip Help Center)
Archiving a stream will immediately unsubscribe all users from the stream, remove the stream from search and other typeaheads, and remove the stream's messages from All messages. | Archiving a stream does not delete a stream's messages. Users will still be able to find any given message by searching for it. However, links to messages and topics in the stream may or may not continue to work. | In most cases, we recommend renaming streams rather than archiving them. | We're here to help! Email us at support@zulip.com with questions, feedback, or feature requests.
could you mail support to see if they can manually undo it?
At least worth a try, yes. I emailed support, so we'll see if there's anything they can do
